column3: str
Hm hm hm... So, you wish to peer into the abyss of thaumaturgy?
What will you ask?
Who are you?
What is thaumaturgy?
Nothing.
I am the Piercing Eye, the Duke of Destruction, the Archmage of Annihilation...though most of my colleagues simply call me “Cocobuki.”
Of the five thaumaturge brothers that claim the title of “Guildmaster,” I am the eldest.
I offer guidance to those wishing to explore the stygian chasm of our discipline, and instruct aspirants in the art of arcane devastation.
It is also my role to encourage the accumulation of thaumaturgical wisdom through both theoretical study and practical application.
Thaumaturgy is a form of arcane manipulation that allows the practitioner to unleash <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> will as deadly manifestations of primal power.
The origin of our art can be found in the cumbersome magicks of our ancestors─subsequently focused and refined through their use in the funereal rites of the Order of Nald'thal.
Though once used exclusively for the preparation of the dead, these incantations of destruction soon found new purpose on the battlefield.
Hm hm hm... “Death,” of course, is still very much the central focus of the discipline.
What's this, what's this? Our finest student, come for a visit?
Hm hm hm... Dabbling in black magery, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>? Yes, your aura has taken on a distinct darkness.

...I am not surprised that a thaumaturge of your unique skill was thus chosen. The ancient arts of destruction are indeed stunning in their magnificence...and deadly in their seductive power. I pray you do not fall too deeply into <Emphasis>that</Emphasis> particular abyss.

Hm hm hm... I see you now flirt with darkness of an entirely different nature. Though my expertise centers upon the arcane, this mundane manipulation is naught to be scoffed at. Tread with care, <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>...
Hm hm hm... You think darkness is your ally? Be wary, <Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, for darkness bears no allegiances.
What will you ask?
How fares the guild?
What can you tell me of thaumaturgy?
Nothing.
Hm hm hm... After our fateful encounter with Mormo, my siblings have taken it upon themselves to craft an entirely new approach to our art.
I am both amused and amazed at the threats they are now capable of facing. Even with all my years of arcane experience, the abyss of thaumaturgy holds nooks and crannies I have yet to explore.

And Cocobusi? He continues with his alchemical research, but now occasionally trades his alembic for an apron. Though his aetheric reserves are as low as ever, I am convinced that the exquisite dodo omelette he served us for dinner last night was produced by some manner of wizardry...

Considering some teaching of your own, are you? Then pay close attention to my introductory explanation. Ahem. Thaumaturgy is a form of arcane manipulation that allows the practitioner to unleash <If(PlayerParameter(4))>her<Else/>his</If> will as deadly manifestations of primal power.
The origin of our art can be found in the cumbersome magicks of our ancestors─subsequently focused and refined through their use in the funereal rites of the Order of Nald'thal.
Though once used exclusively for the preparation of the dead, these incantations of destruction soon found new purpose on the battlefield.
Hm hm hm... “Death,” of course, is still very much the central focus of the discipline.
